comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I'd say this is another of the Bundaberg pics...showing the Burnett River railway bridge in the background. It's definitely not the Victoria Bridge...and it doesn't look like the Indooroopilly railway bridge either...seen here in serious trouble during the 1893 flood www.bonzle.com/pictures-over-time/pictures-taken-in-1893/... ...if this is the Burnett River, then it looks to be within its normal tidal range.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thanks Quasymody, its a tough one, although the lattice work (from this distance at least) does resemble the Burnett River bridge. One to bookmark for an unexpected discovery!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryqueensland/9202669991/ the ship on the rhs looks a bit like the Sydney Belle, seen in this SLQ pic...doesn't quite match up maybe...but it looks to be one of the ships used to bring indentured labourers to Queensland.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thanks Quasymody, we've added that to our records :) The ship on the far right does look remarkably similar to SYDNEY BELLE, if only it was just that little bit more in focus...
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
